  • Constructor Details

    • Shelf

      public Shelf()
      Constructs a new Shelf object with a default size of 6 rows and 5 columns.

  • Method Details

    • insert

      public void insert(int n, List<Tile> tiles) throws ColumnNotValidException
      Inserts tiles into the specified column on the shelf. The tiles are inserted from top to bottom until the column is full.
      Parameters:
      n - The column index to insert the tiles into.
      tiles - The list of tiles to insert.
      Throws:
      ColumnNotValidException - if the specified column is not valid or is already full.

    • full

      public boolean full()
      Checks if the shelf is full.
      Returns:
      true if the shelf is full, false otherwise.

    • getTile

      public Tile getTile(int i, int j)
      Retrieves the tile at the specified position on the shelf.
      Parameters:
      i - The row index of the tile.
      j - The column index of the tile.
      Returns:
      The tile at the specified position, or null if no tile is present.

    • getMyShelf

      public Tile[][] getMyShelf()
      Retrieves the two-dimensional array representation of the shelf.
      Returns:
      The tile array representing the shelf.

    • checkEndGame

      public int checkEndGame()
      Calculates the score for the player's shelf based on tile groupings.
      Returns:
      The total score for the shelf.

    • numberRows

      public int numberRows()
      Returns the number of rows in the shelf.
      Returns:
      The number of rows in the shelf.

    • numberColumns

      public int numberColumns()
      Returns the number of columns in the shelf.
      Returns:
      The number of columns in the shelf.

    • placeTile

      @TestOnly public void placeTile(Tile tile, int row, int column)

    • maxTiles

      public int maxTiles()
      Find how many tiles the client can insert
      Returns:
      max Tile a player can insert
